solution.text:
Given equation is \(2x^2 + _{k}_x + _{j}_\) = 0
Comparing with \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\)
We get, a = 2, b = _{k}_ and c = _{j}_
Now, we know :
i.e., Discriminant = \(b^2-4ac\)
i.e., \(b^2-4ac\) = \(_{k}_^2 - 4\times 2\times _{j}_\)
i.e., = _{{k*k}}_ - _{{8*j}}_
i.e., = _{{(k*k)-(8*j)}}_
Since, \(discriminant\ge 0\)
Thus,Given quadratic equation have two distinct real roots.

content.text: Comment on the nature of roots of the quadratic equation \(2x^2 + _{k}_x + _{j}_\) = 0.
